tags: ðŸ”’ Building Continuum - Chapter 14 â€” Multiple Identities, One Person

Sovereign identity systems make it easy to generate multiple key pairsâ€”and therefore multiple public identities. In Nostr, each key pair becomes a distinct npub. But behind those layered identities stands a single human being. This chapter explores the psychological implications of managing multiple sovereign identities, the tension between fragmentation and coherence, and how Continuum reveals that identity is not singular but structured.

## ðŸ”’ Building Continuum - Chapter 14 â€” Multiple Identities, One Person

Sovereign identity systems make it easy to generate multiple key pairsâ€”and therefore multiple public identities. In Nostr, each key pair becomes a distinct npub. But behind those layered identities stands a single human being. This chapter explores the psychological implications of managing multiple sovereign identities, the tension between fragmentation and coherence, and how Continuum reveals that identity is not singular but structured.
